titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Parliamentary Extracrs, Lists, Etc.
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:58

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection, in multiple hands, of eight booklets bound into one volume, primarily on Parliamentary activities. The manuscript begins with a list of the members of Parliament between 1295 and 1327. Other items include extracts from Parliamentary journals; a list of the customs and privileges of both Houses of Parliament by Robert Bowyer; rules for the House of Commons; and, in Browne's hand, a patent transferring Humphrey de Bohun, Earl of Hereford's office of Constable of England to his brother, dated 1338.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fb160 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Parliamentary Extracts, Lists, etc. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fb160. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

controlaccess.title: Magna carta
controlaccess.subject: Legal documents
controlaccess.geogname: Great Britain -- Religious life and customs -- 17th century
controlaccess.persname: Hereford, Humphrey de Bohun, Earl of, 1309-1361
Northampton, William de Bohun, Earl of, d.1360

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1295-1327. HOUSE OF COMMONS.
[Extracts from the records and journals of Parliament, 1307-1601, c. early 17th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
218 p.
MS with blank pages, some damage.
Divided in four separate parts, bound
in the following order: Parliaments 4
Edw.III - 22 Edw.IV; Parliaments Edw.
VI - Philip & Mary; Parliaments of
Henry VIII; Parliaments of Elizabeth
I. The early extracts are dates of
summons. Includes Bowyer's comments
on lost records, etc.
f.2.

did.unittitle: "Customes and priviledges of the neither house of parliament"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[17th century]
22 p.
MS. Title in the hand of John Browne.
Some blank pages. Extracts from the
journals of Elizabethan Parliaments
(1571-1586).
f.3.

did.unittitle: HEREFORD, HUMPHREY DE BOHUN, EARL OF, 1309-1361
[Patent whereby author transfers his office of Constable of England to his brother on 12 June 1338, 17th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy in the hand of John Browne.
William de Bohun, earl of Northampton
(d.1360). In Latin.
f.4.

did.unittitle: [Extracts and notes on the history of the Magna Carta, 17th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
Autograph MS in Latin.
Includes marginal references and
notes.
f.5.

did.unittitle: [Extracts and notes concerning the hierarchy of the Church, 17th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS in Latin & English. Includes
citations from Bishop Jewell.
Doctrinal and controversial works.
f.6.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT. HOUSE OF LORDS.
"Remembrances of Order and decencie to be kepte in the upper House of Parliament..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[17th century]
18 p.
MS in the hand of John Browne.
Procedure, rules for proxies, etc.
f.7.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT. HOUSE OF COMMONS.
"Rules and Orders of the House of Commons"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[late 16th century]
33 p.
Anonymous MS. Includes a table of
contents divided into topics such as
choice of speaker, reading of bills,
general pardon, etc.
f.8.
